New Records: England bowled out Oman for 47, their best bowling performance in T20 World Cup
England chased the game in just 19 balls, a record in T20 World Cup history in terms of balls remaining
Key Match Events: Adil Rashid took 4-11 with mesmerising leg-spin
Archer and Wood each took 3-12 with the new ball
Bairstow won the game with a four
Pre-Game Insights: England captain Jos Buttler emphasized the importance of winning games and taking advantage of the net run-rate
Oman captain Aqib Ilyas stated that his team couldn't do well in the batting and had a big collapse
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Jos Buttler praised the bowlers for setting the tone with the wicket, and said they would focus on themselves and not the media reaction
Oman captain Aqib Ilyas said that his team had a bad shot selection and would learn from the top players
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's net run-rate went to 3.081, better than Scotland's 2.16
The Australia v Scotland game's weather forecast is 32 degrees in St Lucia with a small chance of rain
